meanings.definition: The act of establishing a homestead.
meanings.sent1: Homesteading requires hard work and dedication to create a new home.
meanings.sent2: Many families enjoy homesteading as a way to live off the land.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors joked that our homesteading efforts turned our backyard into a mini-farm.
meanings.sent4: In the vast wilderness, homesteading is like carving out a piece of paradise.
meanings.sent5: The pioneers' homesteading journey was filled with challenges and triumphs.

meanings.definition: The practice of living self-sufficiently on a homestead.
meanings.sent1: Homesteading involves growing your own food and raising animals for sustenance.
meanings.sent2: Modern homesteading emphasizes sustainability and eco-friendly living.
meanings.sent3: After a week of homesteading, we felt like true pioneers of the past.
meanings.sent4: Homesteading is a way of life that reconnects people with nature and simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The homesteading community shares tips on preserving food and building shelters.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in homesteading.
meanings.sent1: The homesteading family down the road sells fresh eggs and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: As a homesteading enthusiast, she loves to experiment with different farming techniques.
meanings.sent3: The local market always looks forward to the products from the talented homesteading artisan.
meanings.sent4: The homesteading neighbor is known for their resourcefulness and DIY skills.
meanings.sent5: The young homesteading couple dreams of expanding their self-sufficient lifestyle.
